Functions
EM9305 BLE Utility Functions
utils

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides utility functions for the EM9305 BLE controller, enabling configuration, initialization, and management of EM9305 specific features. The utilities support power management, firmware updates, and BLE stack integration for optimal wireless performance.

Key Features

  1. Firmware Updates: Support for EM9305 firmware management.
  2. Power Control: Efficient power state management.
  3. Configuration: Device-specific setup and initialization.
  4. Stack Integration: BLE stack support for EM9305.
  5. Error Handling: Robust error detection and recovery.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure EM9305 hardware
  • Manage firmware updates and verification
  • Control power states and modes
  • Handle device-specific features
  • Process error conditions

Usage

  1. Initialize EM9305 with am_util_ble_em9305_init()
  2. Configure device settings
  3. Manage firmware updates as needed
  4. Handle power management

Configuration

  • Set up firmware update parameters
  • Configure power management options
  • Define error handling behavior
  • Set stack integration options

uint32_t am_util_ble_hci_reset (void *pHandle)
 Reset EM9305 BLE controller.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_sleep_set (void *pHandle, bool enable)
 Set BLE sleep enable/disable for the BLE core. enable = 'true' set sleep enable, enable = 'false' set sleep disable.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_tx_power_set (void *pHandle, uint8_t ui32TxPower)
 set the tx power of BLE

 To do directly transmit test where the DUT generates test reference packets at a fixed interval.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_end_test (void *pHandle, uint32_t *recvpackets)
 End test.

 to do directly output modulation signal. channel ranges from 0 to 0x27, pattern from 0 to 7.
 
uint32_t am_util_ble_receiver_test_ex (void *pHandle, uint8_t channel)
 Receiver test. change channel ranges from 0 to 0x27, return received packets in 100ms.

◆ am_util_ble_transmit_test()

uint32_t am_util_ble_transmit_test ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t channel,
uint8_t test_data_len,
uint8_t pkt_payload )

To do directly transmit test where the DUT generates test reference packets at a fixed interval.

Parameters
channel- Transmit channel, ranges 0x00 - 0x27
test_data_len- Length of payload in each packet, range 0x00-0xFF
pkt_payload- Packet payload, ranges 0x00 - 0x07
Returns
Status Code
